On January 13, 2026, I was on Posit's Data Science Lab to talk about my Positron settings and other neat workflow-y things I use to make my life easier.

{{< video https://www.youtube.com/embed/kqYbJoebrwE >}}

This isn't a standard blog post‚Äîit's mostly just a list of the stuff we talked about, with lots of different links to other resources.

## Positron stuff

- [Air](https://positron.posit.co/guide-r-air.html)
- [Better Comments](https://open-vsx.org/extension/aaron-bond/better-comments)

## Positron connections pane

[**General tutorial**](https://www.andrewheiss.com/blog/2025/07/10/positron-database-connections/)

Real life use cases:

- Mirror of a relational database of Idaho's election results for testing and local development. It's a core part of the [DIY Election Desk](https://andrewheiss.github.io/election-desk/) project that [I presented about at posit::conf(2025)](https://andrewheiss.github.io/election-desk/posit-conf-2025.html) ([see code here](https://github.com/andrewheiss/election-desk/blob/main/etl-pipeline/R/funs_db.R))
- Taking a massive 10 GB zipped CSV file and putting it in a DuckDB database and accessing it through {dbplyr} ([see code here](https://github.com/andrewheiss/tight-tortoise/blob/main/R/csvs-to-duckdb.R))

Example with DuckDB and [{connections}](https://rstudio.github.io/connections/); the same general process works with any other database backend, like SQLite, MySQL, Spark, PostgreSQL, etc.:

```{r}
#| eval: false

library(tidyverse)

# Use nicer DuckDB Connections Pane features
# options("duckdb.enable_rstudio_connection_pane" = TRUE)

# Connect to a database
db_file <- "my_fancy_database.duckdb"
con <- connections::connection_open(duckdb::duckdb(), db_file)

# Add stuff to it
copy_to(
  con,
  gapminder::gapminder,
  name = "gapminder",
  overwrite = TRUE,
  temporary = FALSE
)

# Get stuff out of it
gapminder_2007 <- tbl(con, I("gapminder")) |>
  filter(year == 2007) |>
  collect()

# All done
connections::connection_close(con)
```

### Espanso

[**Download Espanso**](https://espanso.org/) (macOS, Windows, and Linux)

[All my shortcuts and settings](https://github.com/andrewheiss/espanso)

Some things I do with it:

- Typographic things like:

  - `;comm` for ‚åò, `;shift` for ‚áß, `;opt` for ‚å•
  - `;times` for a true multiplication sign √ó, `;minus` for a true subtraction sign ‚àí
  - `;prime1` and `;prime2` for ‚Ä≤ and ‚Ä≥ (like 5‚Ä≤ 11‚Ä≥)

- ‚Ä¶and date things like:

  - `;dt` for "2026-01-13"
  - `;dz` for "2026-01-13T11:06"
  - `;dm` for "2026-01-13 11:06:05"
  - `;date` for "January 13, 2026"

- ‚Ä¶and longer words with repeated letters that I always mess up, like these:

  - `insttn` for "institution"
  - `consttal` for "constitutional"
  - `entrepal` for "entrepreneurial"

- ‚Ä¶and code snippets like `;dplyrsum` for inserting this R code to disable {dplyr}'s grouping messages:

  ```r
  options(dplyr.summarise.inform = FALSE)
  ```

- ‚Ä¶or running a {targets} pipeline with `;tarm`:

  ```r
  targets::tar_make()
  ```

- ‚Ä¶or adding Quarto chunk metadata like disabling warnings and messages with `;wm`:

  ```yaml
  #| warning: false
  #| message: false
  ```

- ‚Ä¶and adding figure dimensions with `;figw` or `;figh`:

  ```yaml
  #| fig-width: 
  #| fig-height: 
  ```

- ‚Ä¶and lots of other Quarto things like panel tabsets (`;;pan`), slideshow columns (`;;col`), includes (`;;include`), conditional content (`;;visible`), callouts (`;;call`), etc.:

  ![](img/callout.png)

- ‚Ä¶and creating boilerplate Quarto YAML front matter with `;;qmd`:

  ![](img/qmd-espanso.png){width="80%" fig-align="center"}
